page.title: 09BURNHAM HIGH STREET
page.content: Burnham high street contains most of the businesses which make up this village.It contains pubs which date back along way.The Garibaldi dates to the 15th C.The fire station still operates and the old market hall and slaughter house are now converted to a residence.In 1813 cattle and horses were traded and the sites of 2 blacksmiths may still be seen.At the S. end of the street there used to be a foundry for agricultural parts.Of businesses of the 1800s ,5 names come down to the 1950s,or further.Almond:builder,Bennett:bakers, Painter:undertaker,Cleare have been butchers 1870-1980.Halls opened their shop in 1839 and now own the supermarket Hallmark.Today's shops now include several estate agents and a health food shop.
